newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah falls on spillover from peso.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah falls on spillover from peso.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah fell against the dollar in early trading on Friday on spillover from the Phillipines after its central bank allowed the peso to move in a wider range against the U.S. currency, dealers said.
"We see some spillover from the peso. Offshore operators are hitting on the swap side. But spot rupiah rates are sliding only some four points from the opening," one dealer said.
Spot rupiah fell to 2,436.5/37.0 at 0200 GMT from 2,432.5/33.5 at the opening. But swap premiums rose across the board, with six-month rates falling to 97.0 from 92.0 points.

The Philippines Central Bank said on Friday that it would allow the peso to move in a wider range against the dollar, a move traders said amounted to the second de facto devaluation of an Asian currency this month.
The peso fell to 29.45 to the U.S. dollar soon after the announcement from Thursday's close of 26.40.
"I think the game is not over yet. That's only the first round. We saw plenty of counter offers from Jakarta, both in the spot and swap market," one dealer in Singapore said.
Dealers said counter selling from Jakarta operators had contained further upside of the dollars and swap rates.
